KPAI Minta Polisi Periksa Kejiwaan Ibu yang Masukkan Bayinya ke Mesin Cuci
06 Nov 2019, 02:07 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Komisi Perlindungan Anak Indonesia (KPAI) mengaku prihatin atas sikap Sutina (36) yang tega memasukkan bayinya ke mesin cuci. KPAI minta kepolisian memeriksa kejiwaan Sutina.
"KPAI menyatakan prihatin masih adanya orang tua, dalam hal ini ibu yang memasukkan bayinya ke mesin cuci. Kepolisian perlu menggali secara mendalam kondisi ibu ini apakah sehat secara mental atau tidak, apakah korban kekerasan seksual atau tidak yang mengakibatkan yang bersangkutan hamil," kata Wakil Ketua KPAI Rita Pranawati melalui keterangan tertulis, Senin (5/11/2019).
Rita mengatakan peristiwa Sutina ini bisa menjadi pelajaran untuk semua orang agar memperhatikan kesehatan fisik dan mental ibu hamil. Orang tua juga diminta memperhatikan tumbuh kembang sang anak.
"Anak masih tergantung nasibnya pada orang tua atau ibu. Sehingga orang tua dan calon orang tua harus benar-benar memahami hak anak," katanya.
"Lingkungan perlu memberikan dukungan bagi ibu yang hamil, bagaimanapun kondisinya sehingga dampaknya anak akan lahir dengan kondisi lebih baik," imbuhnya.
Sebelumnya, baby sitter di Palembang memasukkan bayinya yang baru lahir ke mesin cuci. Ia melakukan hal itu karena malu telah hamil di luar nikah.
Polisi juga memastikan bayi Sutina meninggal karena dipaksakan masuk mesin cuci. Polisi juga mengatakan Sutina melahirkan di dalam kamar mandi tanpa bantuan siapa pun.
"Lahirnya sendiri, nggak ada yang bantu. Untuk kasus tindak pidana kekerasan ini dilakukan oleh ibu kandung sendiri pada anaknya. Korban ini ditemukan di mesin cuci dibungkus kain," Kapolresta Kombes Didi Hayamansyah rilis kasus di Mapolres, Selasa (5/11).

(zap/azr)

KPAI Asks Police to Check Mental Psychology of Women Who Put Their Babies Into Washing Machines
Nov 6, 2019, 02:07 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - The Indonesian Child Protection Commission (KPAI) has expressed concern over the attitude of Sutina (36) who has the heart to put her baby in the washing machine. The KPAI asked the police to examine Sutina's psychology.
"KPAI expressed concern that there are still parents, in this case the mother who put her baby into the washing machine. The police need to explore deeply the condition of this mother whether she is mentally healthy or not, whether the victim of sexual violence or not is causing the child to become pregnant," said the Deputy KPAI Chairman Rita Pranawati through written statement, Monday (11/05/2019).
Rita said the Sutina event could be a lesson for everyone to pay attention to the physical and mental health of pregnant women. Parents are also asked to pay attention to the child's growth and development.
"Children are still dependent on their parents or mothers' fate. So parents and prospective parents must really understand the rights of children," he said.
"The environment needs to provide support for pregnant women, however the conditions are so that the impact of children will be born with better conditions," he added.
Previously, baby sitters in Palembang put their newborn babies in the washing machine. He did that because he was ashamed to have been pregnant out of wedlock.
The police also confirmed that Sutina's baby had died due to being forced into a washing machine. Police also said Sutina gave birth in the bathroom without anyone's help.
"There was no help for her own birth. For this violent crime case committed by her own biological mother to her child. The victim was found in a washing machine wrapped in cloth," Kapolresta Kombes Didi Hayamansyah released the case in Mapolres, Tuesday (11/5).
